questions.question: Half of my friends ……………………… abroad.
questions.description: When the noun following half of is plural, we use a plural verb.

questions.question: You …………………… not wake me up when you come in.
questions.description: Had better is used to give strong advice.

questions.question: Let’s go ……………………… on the weekend.
questions.description: Go is used with an ing form in a number of common expressions.

questions.question: ……………………. I open the window?
questions.description: Shall is often used to ask for a suggestion or permission.

questions.question: I think I ………………….. this bag.
questions.description: The simple future is commonly used to announce decisions that are made at the moment of speaking.

questions.question: We are …………………….. for a lot of rain.
questions.description: Expect is not followed by for.

questions.question: Have you been to Africa ……………………….?
questions.description: Before can at any time in the past.

questions.question: Did you ever visit Barcelona when you …………………….. in Spain?
His movies are wonderful. I have watched every one of ………………………..
questions.description: We use a plural noun or pronoun after every one of.

questions.question: We …………………… go to Thailand on holiday.
Do you ………………………. go to Thailand on holiday?
……………………… I didn’t know anybody at the party, I had a great time.
questions.description: Even though and though are possible here. Even though is more emphatic that although.
